oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Charlotte St. Church of Christ: facade
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Black and white photograph of Charlotte Street Church of Christ's front elevation. The gable-fronted building is constructed of concrete blocks. The building features a gable-roofed vestibule with double doors. Three bays of windows and a chimney adorn the side of the building. The gables of the vestibule and the main building contain weatherboard siding. A decorative pattern appears on the concrete exterior of the church.

Charlotte Street Church of Christ, located in Dickson County, Tennessee, is a rural African American church. The current building, dating to 1940, is constructed of concrete blocks. At the time of fieldwork, Joe Kpana-Quamoh served as minister and the property was deemed "probably eligible."
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee
